Bit World is a digital realm full of digital eggs. No one knows how this world came into existence, or where the eggs come from.

However, what we do know is that using an Android device, coupled with this software, you can acquire one of these eggs.

Once on your device, the egg will begin to mature and eventually hatch into a mysterious creature, known as a Bit Beast!

Raise your Bit Beast well, pit it against other Bit Beasts in battle, and become an expert Bit Beast handler!

Interacting with your Bit Beast is easy! For most actions, you can simply use the buttons on the top and bottom of the screen.

The Status button opens a screen that tells you all about your Bit Beast.

The Shop button is where you go to give your Bit Beast food, water, and medicine.

The Clean Up button will clean up any poop from the yard.

The Bathe button will give your Bit Beast a bath.

The Temp button allows you to control the temperature. You can turn on either the air conditioner, the heater, or leave them both off.

The Play button is where you go when you want to play a game with your Bit Beast.

The Train button allows you to train your Bit Beast, preparing him for combat with other Bit Beasts.

The Battle button allows you to pit your Bit Beast against other Bit Beasts in battle!

The Lights button toggles the lights.

The Options button opens a menu with various options and information on the game.

Of particular interest, the Configuration screen, accessed from the Options menu, allows you to pause your pet and adjust his bed time.

You can also pet your Bit Beast by petting him on the touch screen.

By tapping on the touch screen when viewing the yard (the main view), you can toggle speech recognition. For a list of commands your Bit Beast understands, see the Help page on speech recognition.

As your Bit Beast grows up, he will evolve into different forms based on what you feed him, among other things. Be careful not to feed him too much junk food, or he will become fat!

You can view all of your Bit Beast's stats on the Status screen. The Food, Water, and Happy bars show your Bit Beast's current hunger, thirst, and happiness status, respectively. Fill the bars all the way to take proper care of your Bit Beast!

The Temperature bar shows the current temperature. Bit Beasts seem happiest at exactly 20 °C.

Your Bit Beast's strength is used when battling other Bit Beasts, and he needs energy to battle and train. To permanently raise your Bit Beast's strength, train him.

In the Shop, you can give your Bit Beast food, drinks, remedies, and more!

Water is free, but everything else costs bits. You can earn bits by playing games with your Bit Beast. See the Help page on playing for more information.

Give your Bit Beast a vitamin to restore his energy, medicine if he is sick, etc.

When your Bit Beast becomes a child, he picks a favorite food. This is represented in the Shop by a star next to the food. Feeding your Bit Beast his favorite food makes him extra happy!

Playing Bricks or Rock-Paper-Scissors with your Bit Beast will increase its happiness. If you win, you will also earn some bits.

Shake It!, Journey!, and Go Go Go! make use of various Android features (if your device has them). These games allow you to earn bits.
- To play Shake It!, just shake your device.
- To play Journey!, turn on your GPS and earn bits based on how far you travel.
- To play Go Go Go!, turn on your GPS and earn bits based on how fast you can move!
To train your Bit Beast, you knock a ball back and forth against a computer opponent.\n\nThis requires energy, and will cause him to lose weight. If you win, he will also permanently gain strength.

You can connect to a Bit Beast on another device via Bluetooth to battle them!

Simply connect to a device with another Bit Beast on it, and watch the battle play out!

Additionally, you can select the Shadow Battle option to have your Bit Beast face off against a computer opponent. Note that Shadow Battles do not count towards your Bit Beast's battle record.

By tapping on the screen when in the yard with your Bit Beast, you can toggle speech recognition mode. Your Bit Beast will then listen for keywords that he understands. Note that this uses Android's speech recognition system, so be sure to have it installed!

Your Bit Beast understands the following voice commands:

- His name.
- Praise. Various phrases such as "good boy" will do.
- Say the name of a button to "press" it.
- Saying "AC", "heater", or "neither" will change the temperature setting.
- Say the name of a game to play it.
- Scolding. Various phrases such as "bad boy" will do.
- Try asking your Bit Beast to sing you a song!
- Say "needs" and your Bit Beast will tell you everything he needs.

You can take a screenshot from anywhere in the app by pressing the Search key. Screenshots are saved to a folder called BitBeast located in the public Pictures folder on your external storage media.\n\nShould you, for any reason, want access to your save files, they are located in Android/data/org.cheeseandbacon.bitbeast/files on your external storage media.

We believe that a game doesn't have enough polish until you can see your reflection in it.
